page.title: 13Population & Employment
page.content: ROSNEATH: The influx of MOD personnel has changed the age and identity of population.Formerly mainly ageing, retired community now many young fam- ilies. Their places of origin spread over the country, many from other parts of Scotland and England.Resent- ment often exhibited by English personnel at posting to Scotland but after a time many wish to remain. EMPLOYMENT:Pattern changing as trad- itional apprenticeships reduced in time or scrapped. Tendency towards 'Jacks-of-all-trades'.Older people complete phrase with 'And masters of none'regretting loss of skills.Advent of plastics changing the working world Local employment found in shops, yards sail loft, farms,several small build- ing trade businesses.Principal employ- er MOD Faslane & Coulport. Small numb- er commute to Glasgow and other towns.
